name: piton
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a spike (= a piece of metal with a sharp point at one end) that climbers put in cracks in the rock to support them or to attach a rope to : The climbers follow the cracks in the face where they can wedge their pitons. The cables are attached to the rock face by metal pitons.
More examplesFewer examplesWith cords and pitons they anchored him to the rock.Ropes used to break and welds on pitons broke all the time.He connected his rope to a piton projectile and fired it across the chasm.
